item.title: MindsEye Will Reportedly Drop Publisher IO Interactive Soon
item.content:encoded:
A new report has emerged which claims that poorly-received actioner MindsEye could be about to drop its publisher, Hitman studio IO Interactive, with publishing duties to be handled by developer Build a Rocket Boy in future.

That's according to Insider Gaming's Tom Henderson, who cites "sources close to the impending news" and says that the decision is Build a Rocket Boy's rather than IO Interactive's.

According to Henderson, Build a Rocket Boy wants to "gain more control over its future" and "bring its publishing in-house", as well as continuing to work on updates and patches for MindsEye to improve the player experience. Apparently, that's not something the developer wants IO Interactive to be involved in.

As part of the impending publisher split (which, it's worth noting, still hasn't been officially confirmed yet), MindsEye's upcoming Hitman crossover, which was revealed during last year's Summer Game Fest, will apparently be canceled.

Even if the decision to split with IO Interactive isn't being driven by the Hitman studio, I can't imagine the Danish publisher is too cut up about it. Back in September, IO indicated it might be done with third-party publishing after MindsEye, so this is probably a boon as far as IO is concerned.

In case you need a reminder, MindsEye launched back in June last year, and its launch was chaotic, to say the least. Players demanded refunds within hours of picking the game up, and sponsorships with streamers were pulled at the last second.

Developer Build a Rocket Boy subsequently laid off a wave of employees just a few days after the game's release, and a BBC report in October saw former BARB staff accusing the developer of excessive crunch and having "no coherent direction" during development.

MindsEye is available to check out right now on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S, and you can read our review of the game from back at launch right here.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Zenless Zone Zero Version 2.6 Brings Two New Agents and More in February
item.content:encoded:
The release date for Zenless Zone Zero Version 2.6 has been officially revealed, and you can look forward to new Agents, an exciting new rhythm-based adventure, and much more.

Following on from December's Version 2.5, Zenless Zone Zero Version 2.6 will arrive on February 6th, and it'll revolve around the in-game Angels of Delusion musical group, which is preparing for its first live performance "under the guidance of an enigmatic vocal coach".

You'll be helping the Angels of Delusion with their "training schedules and social media activities", participating in a new rhythm-driven gameplay mode as you work through the events of the so-called "A Harmony of Delusions" centerpiece.

Two new Agents will make their debut in Zenless Zone Zero Version 2.6. The first, Sunna, is an S-Rank Physical Support Agent who can grant big buffs to party members and facilitate quicker switching of characters with her Ultimate.

She's joined by Aria, the lead vocalist of the Angels of Delusion, who's an Ether Anomaly Agent with two distinct forms. Unlike Sunna, Aria is all about dealing big damage, so if you like to tackle problems head-on, she's your fighter.

Reruns for Yixuan and Yuzuha will be appearing as part of this Version cycle's banners, and the Bangboo Biggest Fan will also be added to the game as part of this update, complete with an HP restoration ability and an attack boost around Angels of Delusion.

A number of other bonuses and activities, including a chance to earn Polychromes for logging in and completing daily challenges, will be introduced as part of Version 2.6 as well. Suffice it to say that it's all go in Zenless Zone Zero land.

Zenless Zone Zero is available to play right now for free on PC, PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and mobile devices. Version 2.6, "Encore for an Old Dream", arrives on all platforms on February 6th.
